adjectives.description: authoritative (comparative more authoritative, superlative most authoritative)

entries.meaning: Arising or originating from a figure of authority
examples: The authoritative rules in this school come not from the headmaster but from the aged matron.

entries.meaning: Highly accurate or definitive; treated or worthy of treatment as a scholarly authority
examples: This book is the world's most authoritative guide to insect breeding habits.
He instructed us in that booming, authoritative voice of his.
